publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2262# Mike Pringle: Ban on Sale of Arms to China—That the Parliament condemns any move to lift the 15-year embargo on the sale of arms to China; urges the European Union to resist any move by the German Chancellor, Gerhard Schroeder, and French President, Jacques Chirac, to have the embargo lifted; hopes that other European states will oppose efforts by France, Germany or Britain to restore arms sales; believes that China’s human rights record is comparable to Burma and Zimbabwe’s record, and further believes that this move, if successful, could lead to greater instability in the region.
S2M-2262# Ban on Sale of Arms to China (lodged on 14 January 2005) Mr Mark Ruskell*
S2M-2262# Ban on Sale of Arms to China (lodged on 14 January 2005) Fiona Hyslop*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Elaine Smith*, Michael Matheson*, Rosie Kane*, Eleanor Scott*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-2262# Ban on Sale of Arms to China (lodged on 14 January 2005) Robin Harper*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Robert Brown*, Shiona Baird*
S2M-2262 # Ban on Sale of Arms to China (lodged on 14 January 2005) Chris Ballance*, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-2262 #Ban on Sale of Arms to China (lodged on 14 January 2005) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-2262 #Ban on Sale of Arms to China (lodged on 14 January 2005) Mr Andrew Arbuckle*
S2M-2262# Ban on Sale of Arms to China (lodged on 14 January 2005) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-2262 #Ban on Sale of Arms to China (lodged on 14 January 2005) Dennis Canavan*
S2M-2262# Ban on Sale of Arms to China (lodged on 14 January 2005) John Swinburne*
